definition: style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: Fan Zhongyan s thoughts of official management are rich.
sentences.chinese: 范仲淹的吏治思想非常豐富。

sentences.english: To the casual eye, Seychelles seems both fortunate and well-governed.
sentences.chinese: 從表面來看，塞舌爾很富有，吏治清明。

sentences.english: In fact, the fortunes of China bobbed up and down with corruption levels of government officials.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，中國的興衰跟吏治的腐化程度有密切聯繫。

sentences.english: The breeding ground of corrupt bureaucracy is that of the officials not only serve as referees but also serve as athletes.
sentences.chinese: 裁判員與運動員同爲一人乃吏治腐敗產生之溫牀。

sentences.english: The quality of the management is directly related to the rise and fall of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 吏治的好壞，直接關係到國家的治亂興衰。

definition: laws and discipline of imperial court
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
governor general 总督 and inspector general 巡抚
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
